edu.stanford.math.plex4.utility

Class ComparisonUtility

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.stanford.math.plex4.utility.ComparisonUtility

  • public class ComparisonUtility
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains static methods for comparing various objects.
    Author:
    Andrew Tausz

      • compareDoublesAbsolute

        public static boolean compareDoublesAbsolute(double a,
                             double b,
                             double tolerance)
        This function compares two doubles to see if they are within the specified tolerance of each other.
        Parameters:
        a - the first value
        b - the second value
        tolerance - the tolerance
        Returns:
        true iff |a - b| <= tolerance

      • compareDoublesRelative

        public static boolean compareDoublesRelative(double a,
                             double b,
                             double tolerance)
        This function compares two doubles to see if their relative distance is within the specified tolerance.
        Parameters:
        a - the first value
        b - the second value
        tolerance - the tolerance
        Returns:
        true iff |a - b| / (0.5 (|a| + |b|)) <= tolerance

      • compareDoublesGuardedRelative

        public static boolean compareDoublesGuardedRelative(double a,
                                    double b,
                                    double tolerance)
        This function compares two doubles to see if their (relative/absolute) distance is within the specified tolerance. If 0.5 (|a| + |b|) < 1 it uses an absolute comparison, and otherwise it uses a relative comparison.
        Parameters:
        a - the first value
        b - the second value
        tolerance - the tolerance
        Returns:
        true if the (relative/absolute) distance of a and b is within the given tolerance
